column4: U.S. drillers add oil rigs for 12th week in 13 -Baker Hughes
column5: Jan 27 U.S. energy companies this week added oil rigs for a 12th week in the last 13  extending an eight-month recovery as drillers take advantage of a deal by OPEC to cut production that has kept crude prices over $50 a barrel since early December.     Drillers added 15 oil rigs in the week to Jan. 27  bringing the total count to 566  the most since November 2015  energy services firm Baker Hughes Inc said on Friday.
